name: WBSO (R&D Tax Credit)
description: The WBSO is a tax credit for companies developing technical innovations. It reduces wage costs for R&D activities and other R&D expenses.
eligibility: Dutch companies performing R&D activities, including startups, SMEs, and self-employed entrepreneurs.
deadline: Continuous application, but must be submitted at least one month before the period starts.
applicationProcess: Online application through RVO.nl website, requires detailed project descriptions and planning.
fundingAmount: 32% of the first €350,000 of R&D wage costs, and 16% for costs above this amount.

name: MIT (SME Innovation Stimulation Region and Top Sectors)
description: The MIT scheme supports SMEs with innovation projects, feasibility studies, and collaboration in top sectors.
eligibility: SMEs in the Netherlands working within designated top sectors.
deadline: Applications typically open in April and close in September.
applicationProcess: Application through RVO.nl, requires business plan and innovation strategy.
fundingAmount: Up to €200,000 for innovation projects, up to €20,000 for feasibility studies.

name: Innovation Credit
description: The Innovation Credit helps companies finance risky innovation projects that have promising market potential.
eligibility: Dutch companies of all sizes developing innovative products, processes, or services with substantial technical risks.
applicationProcess: Application through RVO.nl, requires business plan, market analysis, and technical documentation.
fundingAmount: Up to 45% of development costs, with a minimum of €150,000 and maximum of €10 million.

name: Early Phase Funding
description: Early Phase Funding helps startups and innovative companies to explore the technical and commercial feasibility of innovative ideas.
eligibility: Startups and SMEs with innovative ideas still in early development.
deadline: Continuous application, decided by regional development agencies.
applicationProcess: Application through regional development agencies like Innovation Quarter, LIOF, BOM, etc.
fundingAmount: Up to €40,000, covering 100% of eligible costs.

name: Seed Capital
description: The Seed Capital arrangement improves the risk/return ratio for investors in innovative startups and growth companies.
eligibility: Investment funds that invest in innovative and creative startups and growing companies based in the Netherlands.
deadline: Tender arrangements, check RVO website for current deadlines.
applicationProcess: Not for startups directly, but for investment funds that want to invest in startups.

name: Green Project Funding
description: Loans with favorable terms for environmentally friendly projects that might otherwise be difficult to finance.
eligibility: Companies investing in environmental technologies and sustainable projects.
applicationProcess: Application through participating banks who assess if the project qualifies.

name: SBIR - Innovative Procurement
description: The Small Business Innovation Research program challenges companies to develop innovative solutions to social issues.
eligibility: Dutch companies developing innovative solutions to societal challenges defined in specific SBIR calls.
deadline: Depends on specific calls, check RVO website.
applicationProcess: Application through RVO.nl, requires project plan addressing the specific challenge.
fundingAmount: Phase 1: up to €50,000 for feasibility studies. Phase 2: up to €500,000 for prototype development.

name: Horizon Europe
description: EU's key funding program for research and innovation with a budget of €95.5 billion.
eligibility: Companies, research organizations, and universities across Europe, including the Netherlands.
deadline: Various deadlines depending on specific calls.
applicationProcess: Application through the EU Funding & Tenders Portal, often requires forming a consortium.
fundingAmount: Varies by call, can range from €50,000 to several million euros.

name: Eurostars
description: European program supporting international collaboration in R&D projects led by R&D-performing SMEs.
eligibility: R&D-performing SMEs in participating countries, including the Netherlands, collaborating with at least one partner from another Eurostars country.
deadline: Two cut-off dates per year, check Eurostars website.
applicationProcess: Centralized application through the Eurostars platform, requires international collaboration.
fundingAmount: Up to €500,000 per Dutch partner, covering up to 50% of project costs.

name: Growth Facility
description: Guarantees for investors providing equity or mezzanine capital to companies with growth ambitions.
eligibility: Dutch SMEs with growth plans seeking equity investment.
applicationProcess: Application through participating banks and investment companies.
fundingAmount: Guarantee covers 50% of investment, with a maximum of €12.5 million.
